g2901.definition: [κραταιόω] from {{g2900}}; to empower, i.e. (passively) increase in vigor

g2902.definition: [κρατέω] from {{g2904}}; to use strength, i.e. seize or retain (literally or figuratively)

g2903.definition: [κράτιστος] superlative of a derivative of {{g2904}}; strongest, i.e. (in dignity) very honorable

g2904.definition: [κράτος] perhaps a primary word; vigor ("great") (literally or figuratively)

g2906.definition: [κραυγή] from {{g2896}}; an outcry (in notification, tumult or grief)

g2908.definition: [κρεῖσσον] neuter of an alternate form of {{g2909}}; (as noun) better, i.e. greater advantage

g2909.definition: [κρείττων] comparative of a derivative of {{g2904}}; stronger, i.e. (figuratively) better, i.e. nobler

g2910.definition: [κρεμάννυμι] a prolonged form of a primary verb; to hang

g2912.definition: [Κρής] from {{g2914}}; a Cretan, i.e. inhabitant of Crete

g2913.definition: [Κρήσκης] of Latin origin; growing; Cresces (i.e. Crescens), a Christian

g2914.definition: [Κρήτη] of uncertain derivation; Crete, an island in the Mediterranean

g2917.definition: [κρίμα] from {{g2919}}; a decision (the function or the effect, for or against ("crime"))

g2918.definition: [κρίνον] perhaps a prim word; a lily

g2919.definition: [κρίνω] properly, to distinguish, i.e. decide (mentally or judicially); by implication, to try, condemn, punish

g2920.definition: [κρίσις] decision (subjectively or objectively, for or against); by extension, a tribunal; by implication, justice (especially, divine law)

g2921.definition: [Κρίσπος] of Latin origin; "crisp"; Crispus, a Corinthian

g2922.definition: [κριτήριον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{g2923}}; a rule of judging ("criterion"), i.e. (by implication) a tribunal

g2923.definition: [κριτής] from {{g2919}}; a judge (genitive case or specially)

g2925.definition: [κρούω] apparently a primary verb; to rap

g2926.definition: [κρύπτη] feminine of {{g2927}}; a hidden place, i.e. cellar ("crypt")

g2928.definition: [κρύπτω] a primary verb; to conceal (properly, by covering)

g2929.definition: [κρυσταλλίζω] from {{g2930}}; to make (i.e. intransitively, resemble) ice ("crystallize")

g2930.definition: [κρύσταλλος] from a derivative of κρύος (frost); ice, i.e. (by analogy) rock "crystal"

g2932.definition: [κτάομαι] a primary verb; to get, i.e. acquire (by any means; own)

g2934.definition: [κτῆνος] from {{g2932}}; property, i.e. (specially) a domestic animal

g2936.definition: [κτίζω] probably akin to {{g2932}} (through the idea of proprietorship of the manufacturer); to fabricate, i.e. found (form originally)

g2937.definition: [κτίσις] from {{g2936}}; original formation (properly, the act; by implication, the thing, literally or figuratively)

g2938.definition: [κτίσμα] from {{g2936}}; an original formation (concretely), i.e. product (created thing)

g2939.definition: [κτίστης] from {{g2936}}; a founder, i.e. God (as author of all things)

g2940.definition: [κυβεία] from κύβος (a "cube", i.e. die for playing); gambling, i.e. (figuratively) artifice or fraud

g2941.definition: [κυβέρνησις] from κυβερνάω (of Latin origin, to steer); pilotage, i.e. (figuratively) directorship (in the church)

g2942.definition: [κυβερνήτης] from the same as {{g2941}}; helmsman, i.e. (by implication) captain

g2943.definition: [κυκλόθεν] adverb from the same as {{g2945}}; from the circle, i.e. all around

g2944.definition: [κυκλόω] from the same as {{g2945}}; to encircle, i.e. surround

g2945.definition: [κύκλῳ] as if dative case of κύκλος (a ring, "cycle"; akin to {{g2947}}); i.e. in a circle (by implication, of {{g1722}}), i.e. (adverbially) all around

g2946.definition: [κύλισμα] from {{g2947}}; a wallow (the effect of rolling), i.e. filth

g2947.definition: [κυλιόω] from the base of {{g2949}} (through the idea of circularity; compare {{g2945}}, {{g1507}}); to roll about

g2948.definition: [κυλλός] from the same as {{g2947}}; rocking about, i.e. crippled (maimed, in feet or hands)

g2949.definition: [κῦμα] from κύω (to swell (with young), i.e. bend, curve); a billow (as bursting or toppling)

g2950.definition: [κύμβαλον] from a derivative of the base of {{g2949}}; a "cymbal" (as hollow)

g2951.definition: [κύμινον] of foreign origin (compare {{h3646}}); dill or fennel ("cummin")

g2952.definition: [κυνάριον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{g2965}}; a puppy

g2953.definition: [Κύπριος] from {{g2954}}; a Cyprian (Cypriot), i.e. inhabitant of Cyprus

g2954.definition: [Κύπρος] of uncertain origin; Cyprus, an island in the Mediterranean

g2955.definition: [κύπτω] probably from the base of {{g2949}}; to bend forward

g2956.definition: [Κυρηναῖος] from {{g2957}}; i.e. Cyrenæan, i.e. inhabitant of Cyrene

g2957.definition: [Κυρήνη] of uncertain derivation; Cyrene, a region of Africa

g2958.definition: [Κυρήνιος] of Latin origin; Cyrenius (i.e. Quirinus), a Roman

g2959.definition: [Κυρία] feminine of {{g2962}}; Cyria, a Christian woman

g2960.definition: [κυριακός] from {{g2962}}; belonging to the Lord (Jehovah or Jesus)

g2962.definition: [κύριος] from κῦρος (supremacy); supreme in authority, i.e. (as noun) controller; by implication, Master (as a respectful title)

g2963.definition: [κυριότης] from {{g2962}}; mastery, i.e. (concretely and collectively) rulers

g2964.definition: [κυρόω] from the same as {{g2962}}; to make authoritative, i.e. ratify

g2965.definition: [κύων] a primary word; a dog ("hound") (literally or figuratively)

g2966.definition: [κῶλον] from the base of {{g2849}}; a limb of the body (as if lopped)

g2967.definition: [κωλύω] from the base of {{g2849}}; to estop, i.e. prevent (by word or act)

g2968.definition: [κώμη] from {{g2749}}; a hamlet (as if laid down)

g2970.definition: [κῶμος] from {{g2749}}; a carousal (as if letting loose)

g2971.definition: [κώνωψ] apparently a derivative of the base of {{g2759}} and a derivative of {{g3700}}; a mosquito (from its stinging proboscis)

g2972.definition: [Κώς] of uncertain origin; Cos, an island in the Mediterranean

g2973.definition: [Κωσάμ] of Hebrew origin (compare {{h7081}}); Cosam (i.e. Kosam) an Israelite

g2974.definition: [κωφός] from {{g2875}}; blunted, i.e. (figuratively) of hearing (deaf) or speech (dumb)

g2975.definition: [λαγχάνω] a prolonged form of a primary verb, which is only used as an alternate in certain tenses; to lot, i.e. determine (by implication, receive) especially by lot

g2976.definition: [Λάζαρος] probably of Hebrew origin ({{h499}}); Lazarus (i.e. Elazar), the name of two Israelites (one imaginary)

g2980.definition: [λαλέω] a prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. utter words Compare {{g3004}}.

g2982.definition: [λαμά]   or λαμμᾶ;  of Hebrew origin ({{h4100}} with prepositional prefix); lama (i.e. why)

g2983.definition: [λαμβάνω] a prolonged form of a primary verb, which is use only as an alternate in certain tenses; to take (in very many applications, literally and figuratively (properly objective or active, to get hold of; whereas {{g1209}} is rather subjective or passive, to have offered to one; while {{g138}} is more violent, to seize or remove))

g2984.definition: [Λάμεχ] of Hebrew origin ({{h3929}}); Lamech (i.e. Lemek), a patriarch

g2986.definition: [λαμπρός] from the same as {{g2985}}; radiant; by analogy, limpid; figuratively, magnificent or sumptuous (in appearance)

g2988.definition: [λαμπρῶς] adverb from {{g2986}}; brilliantly, i.e. figuratively, luxuriously

g2989.definition: [λάμπω] a primary verb; to beam, i.e. radiate brilliancy (literally or figuratively)

g2990.definition: [λανθάνω] a prolonged form of a primary verb, which is used only as an alternate in certain tenses; to lie hid (literally or figuratively); often used adverbially, unwittingly

g2991.definition: [λαξευτός] from a compound of λᾶς (a stone) and the base of {{g3584}} (in its original sense of scraping); rock-quarried

g2992.definition: [λαός] apparently a primary word; a people (in general; thus differing from {{g1218}}, which denotes one's own populace)

g2993.definition: [Λαοδίκεια] from a compound of {{g2992}} and {{g1349}}; Laodicia, a place in Asia Minor

g2994.definition: [Λαοδικεύς] from {{g2993}}; a Laodicean, i.e. inhabitant of Laodicia

g2996.definition: [Λασαία] of uncertain origin; Lasæa, a place in Crete

g2997.definition: [λάσχω] a strengthened form of a primary verb, which only occurs in this and another prolonged form as alternate in certain tenses; to crack open (from a fall)

g2998.definition: [λατομέω] from the same as the first part of {{g2991}} and the base of {{g5114}}; to quarry

g2999.definition: [λατρεία] from {{g3000}}; ministration of God, i.e. worship

g3000.definition: [λατρεύω] from λάτρις (a hired menial); to minister (to God), i.e. render religious homage
